cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the northern Yucatan Peninsula today, then north-to-north-northeast across the Gulf and inland over the lower Mississippi Valley before accelerating northeast across the Mid-Atlantic and off the New England coast late in the 5-day period.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch/Warning from Tulum to Dzilam, Mexico; Tropical-Storm Watch/Warning portions of western Cuba and northern Yucatan coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Tulum–Dzilam including Cozumel; Tropical-Storm Warning Pinar del Rio Cuba, south of Tulum to Punta Allen and west of Dzilam to Progreso
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula today, then northern Gulf Coast states (LA-MS-AL) mid-week, spreading inland to the Tennessee Valley and Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly to southerly winds 25-35 mph possible Thursday night into Friday as the post-tropical remnants pass south of the area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Boston based on current track and intensity forecasts.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible late Thursday into Friday, locally higher amounts in embedded bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and rip-currents along the Massachusetts coast; minor coastal flooding possible at high tide.
